DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Antiemetic drug , aprepitant , granisetron , dexamethasone , may help lessen prevent nausea vomit patient treated chemotherapy . PURPOSE : This clinical trial study well give aprepitant together granisetron dexamethasone work prevent nausea vomit patient receive cyclophosphamide undergo autologous stem cell transplant .
DOC.brief_title: Aprepitant , Granisetron , & Dexamethasone Preventing Nausea & Vomiting Pts . Receiving Cyclophosphamide Before Stem Cell Transplant
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - Evaluate efficacy addition aprepitant control acute vomit standard prophylactic anti-emetic combination granisetron hydrochloride dexamethasone patient receive therapy comprise high-dose cyclophosphamide mobilize stem cell prior leukapheresis autologous stem cell transplantation . Secondary - Evaluate efficacy addition aprepitant control delayed vomiting patient . - Evaluate efficacy addition aprepitant control overall nausea patient . - Identify side effect addition aprepitant regimen patient . OUTLINE : Patients receive granisetron hydrochloride orally IV oral dexamethasone , follow 1 hour later cyclophosphamide IV 2 hour day 1 . Patients also receive oral aprepitant daily day 1-3 . Treatment continue absence unacceptable toxicity . After completion study treatment , patient follow 30 day . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 35 patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Undergoing autologous peripheral blood stem cell transplantation stem cell mobilization use cyclophosphamide Candidate ( per institutional requirement ) autologous peripheral blood stem cell transplantation No psychiatric illness multisystem organ failure No nausea baseline PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : SWOG performance status 02 Fewer 5 alcoholic drink per day within past year No current illness require chronic systemic steroid requirement chronic use antiemetics No gastrointestinal obstruction active peptic ulcer disease AST ALT ≤ 3 time upper limit normal ( ULN ) Bilirubin ≤ 3 time ULN Alkaline phosphatase ≤ 3 time ULN Creatinine ≤ 2 mg/dL No known hypersensitivity component study regimen Not pregnant nursing Negative pregnancy test Fertile patient must use effective barrier contraception No unrelenting hiccup PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : No chronic therapeutic warfarin > 1 mg dose per day No concurrent investigational agent No concurrent oral contraceptive ( except stop menses ) , tolbutamide , phenytoin , midazolam , ketoconazole , rifampin , paroxetine hydrochloride , diltiazem hydrochloride No concurrent illegal drug
